intro: Apodytes dimidiata var. hazomaitso, commonly known as the Madagascar mahogany, is a small evergreen tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers followed by red, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and slow growth, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a rare ornamental plant.
